why match making is so long

The devs only want to make a game that had OP killers and promote bad playstyles. I have only ever played with friends because random killers are forced to cheese their way to rank one with tunneling, face camping and stupid strats making it hard for survivors to actually play the game. What kinda game is that where the devs dont want you to have fun? Strongly would NOT recommend unless you want infuriating matches that never let you actually play the game. If i could refund at this point then i would because the devs dont deserve my money. They are lucky i still have it in my library

This game is still very active to this day and I can see why! You can either be a killer or a survivor (I must warn you that the killer queues take long to actually get into a game because of the popularity of the killer role) As killer you're main goal is to kill all survivors and to stop them escaping. As survivor you have to fix a certain amount of generators in order to escape. If you're the last survivor then you can either keep fixing generators or find the hatch on the floor to escape. It's quite a fun game and I recommend for people who love multiplayer horror.

Ich Spiele z.B Feng Min die Billige Arbeitskraft...die gerade aus der Fabrik kommt wo sie Adidas Schuhe zusammengen√§ht und Teppiche gekn√ºpft hat. Zudem gibt es sehr viele Killer,auch welche zu Lizenzen wie Freddy Kruger den alten Kinderschreck und viele weitere...zudem hat der neue Killer "Die Zwillinge" eine sehr Kleinen und eine Gro√üen Person....man hat das Gef√ºhl als w√ºrden einen die Kinder aus der Nachbarschaft nerve...zum Gl√ºck kann man in diesen von sich runter ziehen und gegen die W√§nde werfen und gegen Treten. Eine inner Befriedung die man leider im RL bei den Kindern nicht hat. Also Klare Empfehlung.
Kein anderes Spiel frustriert mich so schnell wie dieses.

The community's relationship with the devs of this game is like an abusive domestic relationship. My advice is get out while you still can; they haven't shown any intention of changing their ways after years and years of promising they would.

And then we were acosted by the Binding of Kin update. Watch Bricky's review on Youtube though, it'll be more comprehensive than most of what's written here. The recent HUD update only further proves this, where they ignored their own PTB feedback for a month, that was a banger
I like this game and love to see my progression

I remember seeing the early video reviews of this game when it first came out and thinking "what a buggy pile of garbage", but it is now a testament to what a good and dedicated team of developers can do for a game. The tutorials are still crap and you'll need to watch a few youtube guides to figure it all out, and the learning curve is steep, but it's one of the most rewarding games to learn that I've ever played.

The grind is pretty linear - you get about a level per character per game if you play well enough, the progression is not there to hinder you, it's mostly there to give you the perks, add-ons and offerings you can handle once you learn the mechanics, but again - please don't rely on the game to teach you to play it.
